summary: This is an email from defense attorneys to Judge Alison J. Nathan, submitting Ghislaine Maxwell's response to the government's notice regarding her Rule 17 subpoenas. The document is submitted under seal due to the protective order, with plans to confer on redactions before public filing.

persons.name: Nicole Simmons
persons.context: Attorney from Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C. who sent the email submitting Ghislaine Maxwell's response to the court.

persons.name: Nathan NYSD Chambers
persons.context: Recipient of the email, referring to Judge Alison J. Nathan's chambers in the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney from Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C. copied on the email, involved in submitting the legal response.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Defense attorney copied on the email regarding the Rule 17 subpoena response.

persons.name: Bobbi Sternheim
persons.context: Defense attorney copied on the email regarding the legal proceedings.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney from Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C. who signed the formal submission letter along with Nicole Simmons.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case (U.S. v. Maxwell, Case No. 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)) whose legal team is submitting a response regarding Rule 17 subpoenas.

connections.description: Both are attorneys at Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C. who jointly submitted the legal response on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell.
Simmons is part of Maxwell's defense team submitting a legal response on her behalf.
Pagliuca is part of Maxwell's defense team representing her in the criminal case.
Menninger is a defense attorney copied on the email, indicating involvement in Maxwell's defense.
Sternheim is a defense attorney copied on the email, indicating involvement in Maxwell's defense.

events.title: Government's Notice Regarding Rule 17 Subpoenas
events.description: The government filed a notice concerning Ghislaine Maxwell's Rule 17 subpoenas, to which Maxwell's defense team is now responding.

events.title: Submission of Maxwell's Response to Court
events.description: Maxwell's defense attorneys submitted her response to the government's April 5 notice regarding Rule 17 subpoenas directly to Judge Nathan's chambers.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team submitted a response to the government's April 5, 2021 notice regarding her Rule 17 subpoenas.
The submission was made directly to Judge Alison J. Nathan's chambers under seal due to the protective order in the case.
The defense attorneys planned to confer with the government about redactions before filing the response publicly.
The case is U.S. v. Maxwell, Case No. 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), indicating it's a criminal case before Judge Alison J. Nathan.
The defense law firm is Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C. based in Denver, Colorado.
